His reverence for Roman civilization led him to adopt an idealistic view of Rome as the* centre of the universe. The continuity of the Roman Empire resided in the Roman people‚ and therefore the Emperor’s seat must be at Rome. Petrarch was an Italian rather than an Imperialist. —Hence he could without inconsistency dream of Robert of Naples as the saviour of Italy, champion Cola di Rienzo‚ serveffitheyiscssQgQ and invite the Emperor into Italy. As a critic he was able to expose the forgeries supporting the Austrian claim to a right of succession from the Roman Emperors (Sen. xvi. 5). Cf.
